org.magnos.io
Class Buffers

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.io.Buffers

public class Buffers
extends java.lang.Object

A utility for working with ByteBuffers and BufferFactorys.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

public static final java.nio.ByteBuffer EMPTY
Constructor Detail

Buffers

public Buffers()
Method Detail

setDefaultFactory

public static void setDefaultFactory(BufferFactory factory)
Sets the default buffer factory used by the utility functions provided in this class.

Parameters:
factory - The new default factory to use.

dispose

public static void dispose(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
Disposes of the given buffer by disposing it to the default factory for this BufferUtil. This should be called after a toBuffer or doubleSize when the buffer has no more use.

Parameters:
buffer - The buffer to dispose.

equals

public static boolean equals(java.nio.ByteBuffer a,
                             java.nio.ByteBuffer b)
Returns whether the given ByteBuffers are identical. ByteBuffers are identical when their bytes between their positions and limits are equal. The positions and limits of the byte buffers are not affected by this.

Parameters:
a - The first ByteBuffer to compare.
b - The second ByteBuffer to compare.
Returns:
True if the ByteBuffers are equal within their current bounds.

equals

public static boolean equals(java.nio.ByteBuffer a,
                             int offsetA,
                             java.nio.ByteBuffer b,
                             int offsetB,
                             int length)
Returns whether the given sections of the ByteBuffers are identical. The position and limit of the buffers have no effect on their equality, the offsets given and the length are technically their position and limit but it doesn't affect the actual positions and limits of the given buffers. If the combination of the offsets and the length go outside the bounds of a buffer then false is immediately returned.

Parameters:
a - The first ByteBuffer to compare.
offsetA - The offset in bytes in the first buffer to start comparing.
b - The second ByteBuffer to compare.
offsetB - The offset in bytes in the second buffer to start comparing.
length - The number of bytes in each buffer to compare.
Returns:
True if the ByteBuffers are equal within their current bounds.

fill

public static int fill(java.nio.ByteBuffer src,
                       java.nio.ByteBuffer dst)
Transfers as many bytes as possible from a source buffer to a destination buffer and returns how many bytes were transfered.

Parameters:
src - The source buffer to transfer bytes from.
dst - The destination buffer to transfer bytes to.
Returns:
The number of bytes transfered.

fill

public static int fill(java.nio.ByteBuffer src,
                       java.nio.ByteBuffer dst,
                       int transfer)
Transfers a given number of bytes from a source buffer to a destination buffer. The given number of bytes is trusted in the fact that this method doesn't do checking to determine whether the number of bytes to transfer actually exist in either of the buffers.

Parameters:
src - The source buffer to transfer bytes from.
dst - The destination buffer to transfer bytes to.
transfer - The number of bytes to transfer.
Returns:
The number of bytes transfered.

doubleSize

public static java.nio.ByteBuffer doubleSize(java.nio.ByteBuffer old)
Given a ByteBuffer this will return a buffer double the size with the same data and position. The ByteBuffer given will be disposed, do not use this method if you plan on using old after this method call.

Parameters:
old - The old buffer to copy data from.

toString

public static java.lang.String toString(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
Converts the remaining bytes from a ByteBuffer to a String.

Parameters:
buffer - The ByteBuffer to convert.

toString

public static java.lang.String toString(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                        int start,
                                        int length)
Converts the remaining bytes from a ByteBuffer to a String.

Parameters:
buffer - The ByteBuffer to convert.

toBuffer

public static java.nio.ByteBuffer toBuffer(java.lang.String value)
Converts the given String to a ByteBuffer. The position of the buffer return is 0 and the limit and capacity match the length of the given String.

Parameters:
value - The ByteBuffer to convert.

readString

public static java.lang.String readString(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
Gets a string out of the given buffer. The next 2 bytes in the buffer is the length of the string in characters and then that string follows as a byte array.

Parameters:
buffer - The buffer to get the string from.

writeString

public static boolean writeString(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                  java.lang.String value)
Puts the given string into the buffer where the first 2 bytes put in the buffer is the length of the string and the following bytes are the characters of the string.

Parameters:
buffer - The ByteBuffer to put the string into.
value - The string to put into the ByteBuffer.

getStoredSpace

public static int getStoredSpace(java.lang.String... values)
Given a string this will return its length in bytes when written to a ByteBuffer using putString().

Parameters:
values - The strings to measure.
